item.title: Shrinkflation Trade Makes Beta Glass Winner in Nigeria
item.description: Nigeria’s cost-of-living crisis has helped make packaging company Beta Glass Plc the best performing equity on the Nigerian Stock Exchange, as companies opt for multiple product sizes to manage higher costs.
item.dc:creator: Emele Onu

item.title: US Sees Oil Output Falling in 2026 in Blow to Trump’s Agenda
item.description: The US sees domestic crude production declining next year for the first time since 2021 in a blow to US President Donald Trump’s push for American energy dominance.
item.dc:creator: Mia Gindis, David Wethe

media:content.media:description: An oil pump jack operates at the Inglewood Oil Field in Culver City, California.

item.title: EU’s Proposal for Tougher Russian Fuel Ban Has Bite for Traders
item.description: A European Union proposal to ban imports of petroleum products made from Russian crude oil would have far-reaching consequences for fuel markets.
item.dc:creator: Jack Wittels, Prejula Prem

item.title: S&P 500 Gains on Trade Hopes Before Big Bond Sale: Markets Wrap
item.description: Wall Street investors closely monitoring trade discussions between the US and China sent stocks higher, while Treasuries wavered ahead of a $58 billion auction that will test the appetite for American securities amid President Donald Trump’s fast-evolving tariff war.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth

item.title: Warner Bros. Split Leaves Bondholders With Painful Choices
item.description: Just three years after selling one of the biggest high-grade corporate bonds on record, Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. is giving noteholders the type of tough choices more typically faced by holders of stressed junk bonds.
item.dc:creator: Ethan M Steinberg, Reshmi Basu

media:content.media:description: Signage at a Warner Bros Discovery office in New York, US, on Saturday, Feb. 17, 2024. Warner Bros Discovery Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on February 23. Photographer: Yuki Iwamura/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump Pick Ben Black Seeks More Risk, Private Investors for Development Agency Deals
item.description: President Donald Trump’s surprise pick to lead an obscure federal agency that invests in development finance said he plans to take on more risk and attract private investors to its deals.
item.dc:creator: Loukia Gyftopoulou, Joe Deaux

media:content.media:description: Ben Black, founder of Fortinbras Enterprises, participates in a panel discussion during the Milken Institute Global Conference in Beverly Hills, California, U.S., on Tuesday, May 3, 2022. The event convenes the best minds in the world to tackle its most urgent challenges and to help realize its most exciting opportunities.

item.title: BlackRock Sees Muni Buying Opportunity Ahead of Strong Season
item.description: BlackRock Inc. strategists say it’s time to buy municipal bonds as supply is ample and prices are favorable ahead of the summer.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Rembert

media:content.media:description: Construction on a high-speed rail project in Kings County, California, US, on Monday, March 24, 2025. The Trump administration has launched a review of California's high-speed rail project, adding to long-standing doubts about whether the venture, plagued by cost overruns and delays, will ever be completed.

item.title: Investing in India
item.description: Gurmeet Chadha, Managing Partner & Chief Investment Officer, Complete Circle Wealth; and Saniel Chandrawat, Head of Research & Senior Investment Analyst, Shikhara Investment Management discuss how India is becoming an increasingly attractive destination for investors with Bloomberg's Jeanette Rodrigues at Bloomberg Invest. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Asia’s Private Markets Appeal
item.description: From tech to real estate, family offices are driving sophisticated co-investments and bespoke deals across the region’s fastest-growing sectors. We track the trends at Bloomberg Invest. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Zimbabwe to Ban Lithium Concentrate Exports in 2027
item.description: Zimbabwe will ban exports of lithium concentrates in 2027 as part of a push to make foreign mining companies develop refining operations in the country, a cabinet minister said.
item.dc:creator: Godfrey Marawanyika

media:content.media:description: Lithium bearing rock at a mine in Bikita, Zimbabwe.

item.title: US Stocks Creep Near Records as Traders Eye US-China Trade Talks
item.description: US stocks flipped between small gains and losses on Tuesday as the US and China resumed their tariff talks for a second day in London, with financial markets on edge as the world’s two largest economies try to avoid escalating the ongoing trade war further.
item.dc:creator: Jess Menton

media:content.media:description: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange.

item.title: Bitcoin Pulls Back After Latest Push Toward Record Falls Short
item.description: Bitcoin retreated from the highs of the day after an earlier push toward the record price level set a little more than two weeks ago fell short.
item.dc:creator: Kirk Ogunrinde

item.title: Can Elon Musk Deliver With the Robotaxi Reveal?
item.description: Ben Kallo, Baird senior research analyst, talks about why he downgraded Tesla Inc. stock to neutral from outperform. Tesla is set to start its robotaxi service in Austin, Texas on June 12. Kallo says the the stock's valuation has "gotten ahead of itself" and the rollout will be harder than expected. He's on "Bloomberg Surveillance." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Pakistan Sticks to Fiscal Discipline in IMF-Aligned Budget
item.description: Pakistan slashed spending and pledged to stay the course on fiscal consolidation for the upcoming financial year, reinforcing the government’s commitment to its International Monetary Fund loan program.
item.dc:creator: Malavika Kaur Makol, Kamran Haider

item.title: Rolls-Royce Nuclear May Eventually Top £10 Billion, Analyst Says
item.description: The UK’s decision to pick Rolls-Royce Holdings Plc for the development of its first small modular reactors may lead to a nuclear business worth £10 billion ($13.5 billion) in the next few years, according to a Morgan Stanley analyst.
item.dc:creator: Joshua Gaunt-Warner

item.title: EU Proposes Nord Stream Ban, Lower Oil Cap to Hit Russia
item.description: The European Union proposed a ban on the Nord Stream gas pipelines and the reduction of an oil price cap as part of a new sanctions package that aims to pile pressure on Moscow to end its war against Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: Andrea Palasciano

media:content.media:description: Ursula von der Leyen Photographer: Frederick Florin/Getty Images

item.title: Circle’s Wild IPO Sparks ETF Rush Betting on the Hot Stablecoin Stock
item.description: Wall Street’s ETF machine kicked into high gear just hours after Circle Internet Group Inc. went public, riding the frenzied initial public offering of the stablecoin giant as crypto technologies enter mainstream finance.
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Lee

media:content.media:description: Circle Internet Financial Ltd. signage during the company's initial public offering (IPO) on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Thursday, June 5, 2025. Circle shares surged as much as 235% after the company and some of its shareholders raised nearly $1.1 billion in an initial public offering that was upsized twice amid strong demand. Photographer: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg

item.title: How Space Tech Is Shaping US Defense Spending
item.description: Spire Global sends satellites, which are about the size of a loaf of bread, into space to track atmospheric data to help drive data-driven decisions. The company has contracts with the Canadian Space Agency and has secured a 10-year contract with the US Space Force last month. Theresa Condor, Spire's CEO joined the C-Suite on Bloomberg Open Interest to talk about the role of tech in defense spending. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: From the Hamptons to JFK in An All-Electric Plane
item.description: Beta Technologies flew its fixed-wing, electric aircraft from the Hamptons to JFK Airport for the first time recently. While just a demonstration for now, Beta is hoping to gain certification for its electric aircraft by 2027.Beta Technologies CEO Kyle Clark joined Bloomberg Open Interest to talk about the future of electric aviation. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Bloomberg Surveillance 6/10/2025
item.description: Jonathan Ferro, Lisa Abramowicz and Annmarie Hordern speak daily with leaders and decision makers from Wall Street to Washington and beyond. No other program better positions investors and executives for the trading day. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Portfolio Construction Has Never Been This Hard: Reiner
item.description: JPMorgan Investment Management head of US equity derivatives, Hamilton Reiner, says portfolio construction has become difficult in the current market. The JPMorgan Equity Premium Income ETF (ticker: JEPI) is the largest active ETF by assets. Reiner speaks with Scarlet Fu, Katie Greifeld, and Eric Balchunas on "Bloomberg ETF IQ." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Iran Looks for Planes and Partners in Post-Sanctions Order
item.description: Iran’s national airline is preparing for the day when it’s finally released from the US sanctions that have worn down its fleet and crimped access to other nations.
item.dc:creator: Leen Al-Rashdan

media:content.media:description: Aircraft, operated by Iran Air, at Mehrabad International airport in Tehran. Photographer: Ali Mohammadi/Bloomberg

item.title: Nigeria’s Naira Strengthens as Oil Rises and Trade Worries Ease
item.description: Nigeria’s naira rose for a seventh day to a two-month high against the dollar on Tuesday amid higher oil prices and as investor concerns over US trade tariffs eased.
item.dc:creator: Emele Onu

media:content.media:description: A customer uses a 1000 Nigerian naira banknote in Lagos, Nigeria.

item.title: Risk of Aluminum Squeeze Grows as Key Price Spread Tightens
item.description: A key aluminum spread that’s been the focus of recent intervention by the London Metal Exchange surged into backwardation, signaling the LME market may still be at risk of a squeeze as the main June contract expires next week.
item.dc:creator: Jack Farchy

item.title: Brown & Brown to Buy Accession Risk for $9.8 Billion
item.description: Brown & Brown Inc. agreed to buy Accession Risk Management Group Inc. for $9.8 billion, its largest-ever acquisition.
item.dc:creator: Alexandre Rajbhandari, Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: Buildings stand in the city skyline of Boston, Massachusetts, U.S., on Monday, June 29, 2015. Boston, founded in 1630, is the state's capital and largest city as well as the oldest city in the United States. Photographer: Victor J. Blue

item.title: Uncertainty May Lead to 'Pothole' for Stocks: Seema Shah
item.description: "This is a tough environment for investors," Seema Shah, Principal Asset Management chief global strategist, says. Speaking on "Bloomberg Open Interest," Shah also says the Federal Reserve won't cut rates until at least the fourth quarter. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Auto Parts Supplier Marelli Plans Chapter 11 Bankruptcy Filing
item.description: Marelli Holdings Co., the struggling auto parts supplier for Nissan Motor Co., Stellantis NV and other carmakers, plans to seek Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the US to slash its debt burden and restructure under new ownership, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Reed Stevenson, Giulia Morpurgo, Dorothy Ma

media:content.media:description: The Marelli Corp. headquarters in Saitama, Japan.

item.title: US Quality Stocks Are on Sale: Manulife JHI’s Miskin
item.description: “The sell America trade that we’ve seen for much of this year has made US assets of the best value we’re seeing, pound-for-pound, for the earnings growth you’re getting,” says Matt Miskin, co-chief investment strategist at Manulife John Hancock Investments.

item.title: Vujcic Says ECB Can Wait Until September to Discuss Move
item.description: The European Central Bank is "in a very good position" and can wait before having an in-depth discussion about an interest-rate move, according to Governing Council member Boris Vujcic. "By September we're going to have basically three more rounds of data," the Croatian central-bank chief said during an interview with Bloomberg's Kriti Gupta. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Oil Extends Gain as US-China Talks Boost Optimism on Trade Deal
item.description: Oil climbed for a fourth straight session as the market awaits the outcome of a second day of trade talks between the US and China.
item.dc:creator: Alex Longley, Mia Gindis

media:content.media:description: Storage tanks at a Colonial Pipeline Inc. facility in Avenel, New Jersey, U.S., on Wednesday, May 12, 2021. Motorists across a broad swath of the U.S. East Coast and South are struggling to find gasoline and diesel as filling stations run dry amid the unprecedented pipeline disruption caused by a criminal hack. Photographer: Mark Kauzlarich/Bloomberg
